pr_title: [aws-datastore] Mutation outbox precedence over cloud content

timeline.message:
[aws-datastore] Mutation outbox precedence over cloud content

While applying cloud content back into the local storage, the Merger
must consider whether or not the Mutation Outbox has a change record
corresponding to a model with the same UUID.

If the Mutation Outbox has a pending change for a model of the same ID,
then the Merger shall NOT apply the cloud update. This is to prevent
loss of customer data on the client.

timeline.bodyText:
Can't this just be...
boolean isDelete = metadata.isDeleted().booleanValue();
timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Unfortunately not, isDeleted() returns an @Nullable Boolean. Boolean.TRUE.equals(null) will eval to false.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Same deal. There are three possibilities, null, true, false. I only want to catch one of these, in a null-safe way.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText:
Objects.nonNull is for API >= 24, but otherwise could also write this like:
    .filter(Objects::nonNull)
    .filter(Boolean.TRUE::equals)

Would probably do something like that on the backend with the Java8 stream APIs (similar to Rx filter.)
replies.author: jamesonwilliams
